formattedAddress: 224 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 224 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Meaty fare from Brescia shares menu space with seafood from Amalfi in an airy, high-ceiling room.

originalText.text:
I wanted to share with you a delightful dining experience my son and I had at Azalea this past weekend. It was our first time visiting this restaurant, and I must say, it was truly remarkable!

The service we received at Azalea was excellent from start to finish. The staff was friendly, attentive, and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort throughout the meal. As for the food, it was absolutely delicious! I decided to start with the beef carpaccio, which was perfectly seasoned and tender. For the main course, I couldn't resist trying their steak, and it did not disappoint. Cooked to perfection, it was juicy and full of flavor. And to top it all off, I indulged in a slice of their heavenly cheesecake, which was simply divine.

The tasteful decor of the restaurant added to the overall dining experience. Azalea has created a warm and inviting ambiance, making it a perfect place to relax and enjoy a meal.

Needless to say, we are already looking forward to our next visit to Azalea. With such a delightful experience, we can't wait to explore other tempting items on their menu. We highly recommend you give it a try too.

originalText.text: I had the most delicious girls lunch today at Azalea! The wait staff were simply lovely and the food was delicious! I was very curious about the asparagus and lobster soup of the day - it was incredible! And it was served beautifully. Everyone‚Äôs appetizers and mains were delicious and served promptly. I‚Äôll definitely come back. Would be a great space for a private party as well.

originalText.text: Had dinner with the ‚Äúfamily‚Äù before Wicked Friday night.  Perfect timing , no rushing and all servers were very attentive. Our meal was the best!  Perfect proportions and so fresh. I‚Äôm still talking about it. Calamari chickpea salad, pear salad, bolognese, garganelli arrabbiata‚Ä¶ Divine

originalText.text:
Had the linguine vongole for takeout. Giving it 4 stars but can see the potential for 5 stars. I think having it for takeout -- and not eating until 20 minutes after it was prepared -- did not allow the dish to reach its full potential: the pasta was somewhat dry, with the sauce collecting at the bottom of the takeout container. I would imagine the dish would be quite a bit better if I had dined it -- which I plan to do in the near future üòÑ

I counted 5 shrimps and 7-8 clams, both of which were reasonable quantities. Quality wise, they were good, especially the shrimps.

I think having it for takeout -- and not eating until 20 minutes after it was prepared -- did not allow the dish to reach its full potential: the pasta was somewhat dry, with the sauce collecting at the bottom of the takeout container. I would imagine the dish would be quite a bit better if I had dined it -- which I plan to do in the near future üòÑ

I counted 5 shrimps and 7-8 clams, both of which were reasonable quantities. Quality wise, they were good, especially the shrimps.

originalText.text:
The rigatoni was by far the best thing we had.  The sauce was absolutely delectable and should have also been on the gnocchi dish (that sauce wasn't as flavorful).  The rigatoni was a 5, and the gnocchi a 4.

For drinks, the blackberry old-fashioned, we give a 5!  So good!  We wouldn't get the charcuterie board again as it was nothing to write home about...

We'll be back for the rigatoni and the old fashioned.
